name: C. Stable Groups
statement:
There are n students numerated from 1 to n. The level of the i-th
student is a_i. You need to split the students into . A group of
students is called , if in the sorted array of their levels no two
neighboring elements differ by more than x.For example, if x = 4, then
the group with levels [1, 10, 8, 4, 4] is stable (because 4 - 1
le x, 4 - 4
le x, 8 - 4
le x, 10 - 8
le x), while the group with levels [2, 10, 10, 7] is not stable (7 - 2 =
5 > x).Apart from the n given students, teachers can invite at most k
additional students with levels (at teachers’ choice). Find the minimum
number of stable groups teachers can form from all students (including
the newly invited).For example, if there are two students with levels 1
and 5; x = 2; and k
ge 1, then you can invite a new student with level 3 and put all the
students in one stable group.
